label: 口分田
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: rice fields distributed to individual subjects to cultivate during their lifetimes, from which they were to render tribute to the tennō. Such fields were distributed to individuals through their residential unit headman, or koshu, whose role in census taking and tribute collection was of critical importance to the ritsuryō provincial administrative system. [天皇、戸主、律令]
